item.title: Hello, NWU
item.description: Since Oct. 2023, we have settled down at Northwest Univesity, Xi'an. Thank you to everyone who has helped me along the way.

item.title: Contact us
item.description: JiaLab College of Life Sciences, Northwest University (NWU) Address: 229 Taibaibei Street, Beilin District, Xi'an, Shaanxi 710069, China Telephone: +86 Email: jiaxq.nju@gmail.com [Xianqing Jia] Join us now Updated: 2023-10-15 Postdocs or Research assistants If you have a deep passion for the intricate world of plant evolution, synthetic biology, or the captivating of plant-microbe interactions, and are currently seeking a transitional occupation before settling down permanently, feel free to reach out to Xianqing.

item.title: Members
item.description: Principal Investigator Prof. Xianqing Jia 2023.10 - present: Prof. in Plant Biology, Northwest University 2020.07 - 2023.09: Postdoc in Plant Nutrition, Chinese Academy of Agricultural Sciences 2017.09 - 2020.06: PhD. in Biology, Nanjing University 2014.09 - 2017.06: MEng. in Pharmacy engineering, Nanjing University 2010.09 - 2014.06: BS. in Biotechnology, Qinghai University CV: PDF Email: jiaxq.nju@gmail.com ORCID: 0000-0003-2033-2048 Github: https://github.com/jiaxianqing Google Scholar: https://scholar.google.com/citations?user=FL4RJsIAAAAJ&hl=en Master candidates Feiyu Chen A Northwest University and Hangzhou Normal University jointly trained graduate student.

item.title: Projects
item.description: 1. Evolution of plant phosphate signaling   Plant phosphate signaling, the key to understanding how plants manage an essential nutrient, unfolds as an evolutionary story spanning eons. This journey from ancient adaptations in early terrestrial plants to modern molecular signaling pathways is not only a fascinating exploration of plant life's history but also a critical component of sustainable agriculture and environmental stewardship. As we trace the evolution of plant phosphate signaling, we uncover insights that hold the promise of higher nutrient utilization efficiency and more efficient nutrient management, benefiting both agriculture and ecosystems.

item.title: Tools and Databases
item.description: * for recommended Tools GO analysis agriGOv2 g:Profiler QuickGO REVIGO KEGG analysis KOBAS Pathview Promoter analysis New PLACE PlantPAN 3.0 PlantCARE Subcellular localization Prediction PSI-predictor WoLF PSORT or WoLF PSORT iPSORT cNLS Mapper - Nuclear localization signals (NLSs) SignalP 5.0 - Signal peptide and cleavage sites ChloroP-1.1 - Chloroplast transit peptides and cleavage sites TargetP 2.0 - Mitochondrial, chloroplastic, secretory pathway Plot GSDS2.0 - Gene structure Diagrams - Flow chart Baidu Naotu - Flow chart MapChart - Map chart Evenn - Venn Diagrams ImageGP - Online plot Databases Genome PLAZA* Phytozome* ONEKP* Ensembl Plants CoGe GDA - Genome Database for Angiosperms Fernbase Published Plant Genomes GreenPhylDB v5 PGSB - Plant Genome and Systems Biology MaizeGDB - for maize MarpolBase - Genome Database for Marchantia polymorpha Marchantia - for Marchantia CuGenDB - Cucurbit Genomics Database CucCAP – Harnessing genomic resources in cucurbit crops Sol Genomics Network - for Solanaceae Expression BAR* CoNekT* CoNekT - diurnal-tools Rice Expression Profile Database (RiceXPro) - for rice Rice Expression Database (RED) - for rice OryzaExpress - for rice Gene function The Arabidopsis Information Resource (TAIR) The Rice Annotation Project (RAP) Rice Genome Annotation Project Oryzabase - for rice funRiceGenes - for rice Nature variation - Rice RiceVarMap v2.
